sentences.sentence: It's been weeks since Bucha was under Russian control, but the city is still reeling from the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Dr. Ihor Kovalchuk and Dr. Yevhen Repiov recount life in Bushehr during the fighting, under Russian occupation, and the flood of patients they received in that time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All patients were in serious condition because the logistics did not work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The occupiers did not allow the wounded to be taken away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I've got a torn leg. I'm sitting in the basement in Vorzel or Hostomel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: After the Russians arrived, the doctors were required to wear a white bandage in order to leave the hospital, and only during daylight hours and on foot. They were warned that a vehicle, even an ambulance, could come under fire. Dr. Kovalchuk decided to remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I had the opportunity to leave here when the Russians were on the outskirts of Bushehr, when the war was just beginning. I had this opportunity even before they came here, but I didn't take it. I knew I had to be here, that I had to help people. So I was here until the end, as it happened until the 10th of March.
